{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3464405,"name":"Poyraz Aygül","username":"poaygul","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/poaygul/{size}/235100_2.png","created_at":"2024-12-28T20:30:57.869Z","cooked":"

We’ve been using REV MAXSwerve for a while, and I’ve made several posts about it. We had many problems we had to fix and one of them was us losing bolts mid-match from the module.

We couldn’t loctite it since you had to take apart the bottom part of the module to change the wheels. (we used MAXSwerve Plastic Wheels) This year we use Aluminium ones, and we can change the tread without removing the wheel so that we will loctite the bolts on the swerve module.

I haven’t seen any teams do it on MAXSwerve but read a lot about using loctite on SDS swerves. Any tips/advice? What are pros and cons of using Loctite?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-12-28T20:32:12.116Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":44,"reads":220,"readers_count":219,"score":269.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":477483,"topic_slug":"loctite-on-rev-3in-maxswerve","display_username":"Poyraz Aygül","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60521,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7840 Driver, Electrical, Strategy"},"post_url":"/t/loctite-on-rev-3in-maxswerve/477483/1","custom_user_title":"7840 Driver, Electrical, Strategy","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3464416,"name":"Travis Norris","username":"TNorris","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tnorris/{size}/203666_2.png","created_at":"2024-12-28T20:39:36.641Z","cooked":"

In general, threadlocker is recommended for most bolts that go into tapped aluminum holes (Just not around polycarbonate unless you use the right kind that is plastic safe).

Refer to the MAXSwerve assembly guide which suggests threadlocker in the steps required. For instance

Fasten the Active Fork in place with two 1in 10-32 socket head screws, applying threadlocker to the screws. Leave these screws slightly loose.
Remember to come back after MAXSwerve Wheel Installation and tighten these screws in the same day to ensure the threadlocker is effective.

Edit: REV also has a video that goes into detail.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-12-28T20:41:34.792Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":209,"readers_count":208,"score":61.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":477483,"topic_slug":"loctite-on-rev-3in-maxswerve","display_username":"Travis Norris","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.revrobotics.com/ion-build-system/build-guides/maxswerve-module-assembly","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"MAXSwerve Module Assembly | ION BUILD SYSTEM","clicks":8},{"url":"https://youtu.be/NBidlgtRSsE?si=oWyO1X7Wd3LhaXkn","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":2}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":39882,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Head Coach - FRC 2423 | NEMC Planning Committee"},"post_url":"/t/loctite-on-rev-3in-maxswerve/477483/2","custom_user_title":"Head Coach - FRC 2423 | NEMC Planning Committee","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3464438,"name":"Eliot Dunn","username":"Eliot","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/eliot/{size}/207280_2.png","created_at":"2024-12-28T21:39:04.704Z","cooked":"
poaygul:

We couldn’t loctite it since you had to take apart the bottom part of the module to change the wheels. (we used MAXSwerve Plastic Wheels)

Locktite it every time you take it off, no matter what wheels you use.

All of the wheels that rev sells allow you to take out the wheel without removing the forks.

poaygul:

I haven’t seen any teams do it on MAXSwerve

111 locktites every bolt in maxswerve that isn’t going into a nylock nut or holding tread on (tread is squishy so it naturally stops bolts from vibrating loose). I would reccomend every team do the same.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-12-28T21:39:04.704Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":159,"readers_count":158,"score":76.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":477483,"topic_slug":"loctite-on-rev-3in-maxswerve","display_username":"Eliot Dunn","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52966,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"111 Alum"},"post_url":"/t/loctite-on-rev-3in-maxswerve/477483/3","custom_user_title":"111 Alum","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3464451,"name":"Patrick","username":"Patrick3357","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/patrick3357/{size}/169915_2.png","created_at":"2024-12-28T21:58:44.351Z","cooked":"

Yeah, you gotta use loctite on pretty much every screw on any swerve even the ones you take out regularly. If you assemble a Maxswerve properly and loctite everything, they are quite durable. You may or may not need to take the forks off to replace wheels (the ones sold by REV don’t require it, but Thrifty’s wider wheels do). I’d recommend against replacing tread while the wheel is still on the robot, it is already easy enough to cross thread the holes when you can freely hold the wheel in any position you want, not to mention keeping treaded wheels ready to swap in is much faster if something goes wrong an a tread or wheel is damaged.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-12-28T21:58:44.351Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":136,"readers_count":135,"score":52.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":477483,"topic_slug":"loctite-on-rev-3in-maxswerve","display_username":"Patrick","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52597,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Build mentor"},"post_url":"/t/loctite-on-rev-3in-maxswerve/477483/4","custom_user_title":"Build mentor","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3464469,"name":"Eliot Dunn","username":"Eliot","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/eliot/{size}/207280_2.png","created_at":"2024-12-28T22:24:34.823Z","cooked":"
Patrick3357:

I’d recommend against replacing tread while the wheel is still on the robot

This is one thing I’d disagree on. Having two sets of wheels, pretreading them, and then swapping them very quickly is the best in-pit experience imo. It does cost you an extra 100 bucks, but I think it’s worth it for the quick wheel changes. Especially with the new rev wheels, you can’t cross thread as easily because the holes in the tread are pre-made for you.
